resources.string: GigAdvisor is an experimental platform designed to work within the scenario of digital labor platforms, a phenomenon marked by a variety of issues - low levels of social protection for gig-workers; pervasive algorithmic control; tomization of work processes, etc. - that increase the need for more insightful empirical investigations and effective regulatory solutions. The platform allows crowdworkers to express, share and discuss different kinds of assessments (by means of predefined scales and free text) on the quality of their experiences with the platforms they work for. Resulting from a research project that brings together labor studies and data-driven computational social science (CSS), the initiative is an attempt to explore new approaches to the analysis and regulation of digital economy.

The first goal is to gather data to be used in CSS research on gig economy.\n Data collected through users’ interaction with the tool - enriched with geographical and temporal metatags - will not only be made available to the workers thanks to real-time visualizations, but also exploited for research purposes. Social network analysis, sentiment analysis and other CSS methods can be precious to answer questions of both normative and empirical nature:
assess the impact of legislative policies
support ​(temporally and spatially) ​fine-grained investigation about working conditions
identify patterns in the behavior of market operators (e.g. unfair practices) Regulatory design Drawing from the “techno-regulation” paradigm - the idea of influencing individuals by building norms or nudge strategies into technological devices (Leenes 2013) - a second goal is to start fiddling with the design of solutions allowing to exploit the regulatory effects that can be induced by tools allowing to build up a reputational image of labor platforms. Special attention will be paid, in this vein, to figure out new ways to leverage the power of analytics and visualization to increase the conditioning power of a “data-enhanced” reputation.

La sicurezza sul lavoro in Italia è normata dal DLgs. 81/08 o Testo Unico sulla Sicurezza sul Lavoro. La legge stabilisce regole, procedure e misure preventive da adottare per rendere più sicuri i luoghi di lavoro, quali essi siano. L’obiettivo è quello di evitare o comunque ridurre al minimo l’esposizione dei lavoratori a rischi legati all’attività lavorativa per evitare infortuni o incidenti o, peggio, contrarre una malattia professionale.La sicurezza sul lavoro è a carico del datore di lavoro, dipendenti o collaboratori che devono comunque adottare un comportamento consono alla struttura in cui si trovano o alla mansione loro affidata.

The tool, still under development, currently encompasses three components:
"Rate your gig" The module allows crowdworkers to evaluate digital labor platforms they work for, according to a series of predefined criteria (e.g. employer fairness, payment timeliness) mapping most relevant
"See platform's rating" The module offers the real-time analysis and visualization of data resulting from the assessments made by crowd workers using the “RATE YOUR GIG!”
"Connect with others" A forum allowing crowd workers to discuss issues and share ideas about their working experience.

We are planning to use GigAdvisor within experimental settings involving real workers and designed in collaboration with unions and gig-workers associations. If you are interested, feel free to contact us.
Lettieri, Nicola, et al. Platform Economy and Techno-Regulation—Experimenting with Reputation and Nudge. Future Internet, 2019, 11.7: 163.
De Minicis, M., Donà, S., Lettieri, N., & Marocco, M. (2019). Disciplina e tutela del lavoro nelle digital labour platform. Un modello di tecno-regolazione.

Lettieri N., Digital Labour platforms, algorithmic governance and techno-regulation: towards the computational evolution of law and labor studies. Talk presented at the "Reshaping Work 2019" International Conference - Amsterdam - 24 October 2019
This is a prototype of an experimental mobile-application under development for pure research purposes. Data presented in following pages are fictitious.
Researcher at INAPP, Rome. Adjunct professor of Legal informatics at the University of Sannio
Associate professor at the Department of Computer Science of the University of Salerno, member of ISISLab
Research fellow and adjunct professor at Department of Computer Science of the University of Salerno
Research fellow at the Department of Computer Science of the University of Salerno and member of ISISLab
Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science \n at the University of Salerno

I dati inseriti in questo form di recensione verranno utilizzati per scopi puramente di ricerca. Tutto ciò che viene espresso è visualizzato in forma assolutamente anonima. I dati non verranno mostrati in nessun modo.
This module allows crowd workers to evaluate digital labour platforms they work for, according to a series of predefined criteria
This module shows real-time analysis\nand visualization of data resulting from the assessments made by crowd workers.
The project stems from an ongoing interdisciplinary collaboration involving researchers with a background in legal informatics, computer science, labor law, economic sociology.
Researcher at INAPP. Head of the research group \"Technological innovation, industrial relations and labor market\"
Researcher at INAPP. Member of the research group \"Technological innovation, industrial relations and labor market\"
Researcher fellow at INAPP. Member of the research group \"Technological innovation, industrial relations and labor market\"

GigAdvisor is an experimental app for data driven exploration of platform economy. Designed for gigworkers, researchers and citizens, the tool implements the following pipeline:
To assess the platform you have been working form please register/login.
To download raw data stored on GigAdvisor, please login.
